metadata.Title: CVE-2019-15216 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.0.14. There is a NULL pointer dereference caused by a malicious USB device in the drivers/usb/misc/yurex.c driver. It was discovered that a race condition existed in the USB YUREX device driver in the Linux kernel. A physically proximate attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15216` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-157-generic - 4.4.0-157.185
linux-image-4.4.0-157-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-157.185
linux-image-4.4.0-157-lowlatency - 4.4.0-157.185
linux-image-4.4.0-157-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-157.185
linux-image-4.4.0-157-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-157.185
linux-image-4.4.0-157-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-157.185
linux-image-4.4.0-157-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-157.185
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-157-generic - 4.4.0-157.185
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-157-lowlatency - 4.4.0-157.185
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> Setting priority to negligible since this simple DoS requires a malicious USB device to be inserted into the system

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-157.185').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1090.101').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1047.49~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1056.61').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1041.43').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1052.59').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1022.25~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1117.126').
linux-signed package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-157.185').
linux-signed-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1047.49~16.04.1').
linux-signed-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1056.61').
linux-signed-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1041.43').
linux-signed-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1').
linux-signed-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-signed-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1022.25~16.04.1').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1121.127').
